title: Need assistance filling out General Denial Form.
question: My husband was summoned to appear in court this month for an unpaid credit card. I have General Denial Form and need to make sure that it is filled out correctly before filing with court.
answers:
As I stated, do not worry about the affirmative defenses in Section 2. Leave it blank. It will not effect your answer.

A Summons doesn't mean anyone actually has to appear in court. It means that the defendant has 30 days from the date of service to file an answer or other pleading to avoid a default.

I respectfully disagree with my colleague that not asserting affirmative defenses won't affect your answer, it may waive these defenses if they're not asserted now.

I also wonder whether your husband should even be defending this lawsuit. Are there any meritorious defenses, or does this just delay the inevitable, and add higher interest and legal fees to the debt? Is bankruptcy an option? Is Legal Aid help an option?
